title: HTML exercises

parsed_exercises.title: HTML basic page structure
parsed_exercises.description: Below you can find an empty html page called index.html. Fill in it with the basic HTML tags, containing at least html5 doctype, html, body and head. Give the id main to the body. Pressing the button Run code (play) on the top right corner, you will be able to see the HTML page and the test result. Pressing the title HTML exercises or the selector beside it you can access the different exercises of this autoevaluation test.

parsed_exercises.title: My first HTML page
parsed_exercises.description:
The next page contains the basic HTML page structure. As you can see it contains the main tags: and . Study how these tags contain one another and add the following inside the body: - An h1 element with the id attribute "title" and the content "My first HTML page" - A paragraph (

) element with the class "myp" and the content a first text of your choice - In the content of the paragraph with class "myp" add a with class red - An image below the paragraph using an tag, with id "myimg", attributes width and height 300px, and for the src use an absolute URL of your choice.

parsed_exercises.title: More HTML tags
parsed_exercises.description: There are many HTML tags, in this exercise you find again an empty html page and you have to add the following: - a tag indicating that the charset for the page is UTF-8, use the new HTML5 notation for this. - a </code> tag with content "My second page" - a <code><div></code> with id "wrapper" that will enclose the next elements: - a link to the w3c page (https://www.w3.org/) with id <b>mylink</b> - a unordered list <code><ul></code> with id <b>mylist</b> and this list contains 2 items (<code><li></code>) with text "First item" and "Second item"

parsed_exercises.title: HTML5 semantic tags
parsed_exercises.description:
For our MOOC we are creating a blog. We have the following HTML structure, but we want to use the HTML5 semantic tags instead of using divs everywhere.
Change the DOM replacing the divs for the HTML5 semantic tags (don't forget to close the tags that you add). See the class of the different elements to have a clue of what semantic tag you should use.
parsed_exercises.content:
MOOC blog

  • Frontpage
  • Old posts
  • Contact
First post of the blog
This is the first post of many in this blog! We are happy to have a blog for our MOOC.
Footer: contact info contact@example.com
